PageTitle: peer ip-prefix export (BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view)(IPv4)
FuncDef:
The peer ip-prefix export command configures a policy based on an IP prefix list for filtering BGP routes to be advertised to a specified peer.
The undo peer ip-prefix export command cancels this configuration. The peer ip-prefix export command configures a policy based on an IP prefix list for filtering BGP routes to be advertised to a specified peer. The undo peer ip-prefix export command cancels this configuration. By default, no route filtering policy based on an IP address prefix list is configured for a peer.
ParentView: BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv4 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an IPv4 peer address.
It is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the name of an IP prefix list.
The name is a string of 1 to 169 case-sensitive characters, with spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Applies a filtering policy to the routes to be advertised to a peer.
-

Examples: [~HUAWEI] ip ip-prefix prefix1 permit 0.0.0.0 32 greater-equal 32 less-equal 32
ExtraInfo: To filter routes to be advertised to a specified peer, you can run the peer ip-prefix export command to configure a route filtering policy based on an IP prefix list.
